body: Can you try whether 1.2.4 works?

> Can you try whether 1.2.4 works?

I am having this problem on 1.2.5, but it does work properly in 1.2.4, I've just tried it.
@craigp thanks for trying that, I did not had a chance to test it yet...
It seems to be related to the update of Squirrel.Mac. /cc @joshaber
@craigp @ghego1 Let's try to find more logs. Go to `~/Library/Application Support/your-bundle-id.ShipIt` and `~/Library/Caches/your-bundle-id.ShipIt` and check out the logs in there.
Having the same issue on OSX 10.11.5
There wasn't much log generated related to this as far as I can see. Though I do see an extracted app binary under ~/Library/Application Support/your-bundle.ShiptIt/updatexxxxx/
Try updating to Electron 1.3+. If you're still seeing the problem, your logs should be in `~/Library/Caches/your-bundle.ShiptIt` (note that the location changed).

Does anybody can confirm than problem solved in 1.3.3/4?

In 1.2.7 can confirm error in ShipIt/stderr.log with "File not found", and all process of auto update of application can finish with 3 results:
1. Success: updated and app restarted
2. Fail: app not updated but restarted (rear, but reproducible, all process of auto update passed well, except error with "File not found" which is not affect, as I understand, update process) 
3. Fail: app not updated and doesn't restarted (found once, not sure is it updater issue, that app doesn't restarted. Without it seems to be result n. 2)
I'm having the same problem with 1.2.6, is this fixed in 1.3.5?

> @joshaber do you think it might have something to do with Squirrel/Squirrel.Mac@413b1d2 ?

It's certainly possible, but given that some folks are reporting it in 1.2.6 makes me think it's something else.

We were using 1.2.6 for 2 months now and we got out few updates, everything worked perfectly, after the last OSX update the app has problems updating, i think this is related to Squirrel. See this issue regarding Squirrel logs:
https://github.com/Squirrel/Squirrel.Mac/issues/181
It seems the problem is that we changed the codesign certificate that has other identity, the updater fails to install the new certificate :)

In our case my feeling is that this issue is due to the fact that we build the app also with xcode (macgap). It has a different `bundle identifier`, but the app name and certificate used are the same.
Does this sound like a plausible cause?

Also running into this issue with Electron 1.4.0 and MacOS 10.12

I am running as an Admin user and have installed the application in /Applications

My system.log is filled with these as some others have reported:

```
Sep 27 11:29:02 Daniels-MacBook-Pro-15 com.apple.usbmuxd[98]: HandleUSBMuxConnect Client 0x7faa44f0a470-SketchMirrorHelper/NULL requesting attach to 0x176:55334 failed, no such device
Sep 27 11:29:03 Daniels-MacBook-Pro-15 com.apple.usbmuxd[98]: HandleUSBMuxDictionary client 0x7faa44f0a470-SketchMirrorHelper/NULL using library 1, running usbmuxd-374.70
Sep 27 11:29:03 Daniels-MacBook-Pro-15 com.apple.usbmuxd[98]: HandleUSBMuxConnect Client 0x7faa44f0a470-SketchMirrorHelper/NULL requesting attach to 0x176:55334 failed, no such device
Sep 27 11:29:03 Daniels-MacBook-Pro-15 com.apple.xpc.launchd[1] (ai.ark.arkIDE.ShipIt[57611]): Service could not initialize: 16A323: xpcproxy + 11769 [1475][625A730D-D6CA-3B26-ABFC-E0FD9005BAB6]: 0xd
Sep 27 11:29:03 Daniels-MacBook-Pro-15 com.apple.xpc.launchd[1] (ai.ark.arkIDE.ShipIt): Service only ran for 0 seconds. Pushing respawn out by 2 seconds.
```

Also ~/Library/Caches/ai.ark.arkIDE.ShipIt/ShipIt_stderr.log show the following, which was only logged the first time I attempted an update. This log is no longer being populated, most likely since  the service is crashing or not running

```
2016-09-22 13:47:07.820 ShipIt[12939:865137] Installation error: Error Domain=SQRLShipItRequestErrorDomain Code=2 "Could not read update request" UserInfo={NSLocalizedDescription=Could not read update request, NSUnderlyingError=0x7fda9e2012b0 {Error Domain=NSCocoaErrorDomain Code=260 "The file “ShipItState.plist” couldn’t be opened because there is no such file." UserInfo={NSFilePath=/var/root/Library/Caches/ai.ark.arkIDE.ShipIt/ShipItState.plist, NSUnderlyingError=0x7fda9e200560 {Error Domain=NSPOSIXErrorDomain Code=2 "No such file or directory"}}}}
2016-09-22 13:47:07.820 ShipIt[12939:865137] ShipIt quitting
2016-09-22 13:47:09.852 ShipIt[12940:865177] Installation error: Error Domain=SQRLShipItRequestErrorDomain Code=2 "Could not read update request" UserInfo={NSLocalizedDescription=Could not read update request, NSUnderlyingError=0x7f80b65154f0 {Error Domain=NSCocoaErrorDomain Code=260 "The file “ShipItState.plist” couldn’t be opened because there is no such file." UserInfo={NSFilePath=/var/root/Library/Caches/ai.ark.arkIDE.ShipIt/ShipItState.plist, NSUnderlyingError=0x7f80b6513e60 {Error Domain=NSPOSIXErrorDomain Code=2 "No such file or directory"}}}}
2016-09-22 13:47:09.852 ShipIt[12940:865177] ShipIt quitting
2016-09-22 13:47:11.892 ShipIt[12941:865223] Installation error: Error Domain=SQRLShipItRequestErrorDomain Code=2 "Could not read update request" UserInfo={NSLocalizedDescription=Could not read update request, NSUnderlyingError=0x7fae6db09b20 {Error Domain=NSCocoaErrorDomain Code=260 "The file “ShipItState.plist” couldn’t be opened because there is no such file." UserInfo={NSFilePath=/var/root/Library/Caches/ai.ark.arkIDE.ShipIt/ShipItState.plist, NSUnderlyingError=0x7fae6db0a8d0 {Error Domain=NSPOSIXErrorDomain Code=2 "No such file or directory"}}}}
2016-09-22 13:47:11.893 ShipIt[12941:865223] ShipIt quitting
2016-09-22 13:47:13.928 ShipIt[12945:865311] Installation error: Error Domain=SQRLShipItRequestErrorDomain Code=2 "Could not read update request" UserInfo={NSLocalizedDescription=Could not read update request, NSUnderlyingError=0x7fea08500fe0 {Error Domain=NSCocoaErrorDomain Code=260 "The file “ShipItState.plist” couldn’t be opened because there is no such file." UserInfo={NSFilePath=/var/root/Library/Caches/ai.ark.arkIDE.ShipIt/ShipItState.plist, NSUnderlyingError=0x7fea08500e70 {Error Domain=NSPOSIXErrorDomain Code=2 "No such file or directory"}}}}
2016-09-22 13:47:13.928 ShipIt[12945:865311] ShipIt quitting
2016-09-22 13:47:15.955 ShipIt[12946:865320] Installation error: Error Domain=SQRLShipItRequestErrorDomain Code=2 "Could not read update request" UserInfo={NSLocalizedDescription=Could not read update request, NSUnderlyingError=0x7f81c0f1e6b0 {Error Domain=NSCocoaErrorDomain Code=260 "The file “ShipItState.plist” couldn’t be opened because there is no such file." UserInfo={NSFilePath=/var/root/Library/Caches/ai.ark.arkIDE.ShipIt/ShipItState.plist, NSUnderlyingError=0x7f81c0f1cfe0 {Error Domain=NSPOSIXErrorDomain Code=2 "No such file or directory"}}}}
2016-09-22 13:47:15.955 ShipIt[12946:865320] ShipIt quitting
```

I can confirm that there is no file at `/var/root/Library/Caches/ai.ark.arkIDE.ShipIt/ShipItState.plist`

This is not happening for everyone on our team. Any ideas/thoughts/clues?

Quick update: Deleting ~/Library/Caches/ai.ark.arkIDE.ShipIt and ~/Library/Caches/ai.ark.arkIDE and restarting fixed the issue. Not sure what caused it but hopefully this information is helpful to figuring out the root cause

The Electron version that came out today, 1.4.7, upgraded to Squirrel.Mac@0.3.0. Are people still experiencing this issue or has it gone away on 1.4.x? If you are still experiencing it, can you try 1.4.7 and see if it is working there? Thanks.
